Articles.Content: i updated from 1.3.1 to 1.4.2 and just saw a lot of things got better, perfomance, game loads faster, the only problem is the damn landing legs that explode everytime i hope squad fix the landing legs bug in next update

It is two steps forward and one back. Or maybe the other way around. 

Quite a lot of show-stopper bugs for you to spot soon.

Huh

I didn't realise this was a bug. I just thought I'd suddenly got absolutely awful at landings despite nearly 2000 hours of playtime.

Makes much more sense tbh.

What I really could not tolerate on 1.4.2 in a glitch on Editor, where the Part I'm fine tuning automatically move to a SNAP place when I select it (if the part is clipping to some other), even with the Snap button turned off.

So, or I get into the right place on the first try, or the damned thing goes to a snap point when I try to replace/rotate it again.

I moved back to 1.4.1 for this only reason.

Edited April 5, 2018 by Lisias
Man.  This version is great expect for that one broken part that breaks one of the main parts gameplay!

1.4.2 is awesome, everything is cool when your launching the team
1.4.2 is awesome, when you're designing the dream

1.4.2 is better cause parts stick together
Some have said you and I are gonna fly forever?
Lets launch forever
We're the same unlike you, you're like me we're all playing in harmony

...

12 hours ago, Foxster said:

It is two steps forward and one back. Or maybe the other way around. 

More like 32 steps to the left, then BOOM.
I'm still playing v1.2.2 and the worst of my worries are seams on planets & moons and wonky fairings on stage decouplers. From the sound of things, I'll be playing v1.2.2 for some time to come.

My own opinion... as if I haven't said this a bunch of times already... I love, love, love 1.4.2 and the DLC, and could not be happier!!! Well, I could, but @SQUAD isn't going to add Emiko's name in the game just to make me happier... lmao....

the game runs a lot better in performance than 1.2.2 does by leaps.

16 minutes ago, invision said:

the game runs a lot better in performance than 1.2.2 does by leaps.

Agreed.  But the inclusion of "pesky bugs that should have never made it past QA" remain an issue.  Do we want a buggy game that performs, or a non-buggy game that lags?  We seem to be flip-flopping  in various degrees between these two modalities since .21

(and now a slight digression)

Ok sure, there is no definitive answer to be derived from (us) players to this problem (in this KSP specific instance) . However, in principle: Defining design requirements, establishing viable use cases, aligning comprehensive test plans and enabling internal and external resources to execute them seems to be a nice place to start.

I still get the impression that KSP Development seems to operate on an eternal "shoestring budget under thumb-screws" so to speak.

This is just my impression (to be clear --> regarding leadership and management only) and is not a criticism of the @SQUAD Dev-team who are very likely working their socks off every day.  They do care about this product (and it shows).  

My feeling is that they (and we) would benefit from a mid to long-term investment in Dev-team resources to help things along.  More importantly, the autonomy of our Developers' regarding base-game improvements vs DLC could be better optimised. (Let them do what they want based on player feedback)

Example:  Does anyone recall a major upsurge in player demand for a "mission builder" and DLC?  I don't recall that.  Sure, there was a buzz following its announcement, but that was "the tail wagging the dog" - and a sure fire way of generating more revenue (clearly not a bad thing if executed more perfectly, but it was NOT born by way of player demand - rather guided by player input after its announcement).  What players want yesterday and NOW is a less buggy basic game - not more paid DLC that adds additional bugs.

(Returning from the digression)

I like the recent performance enhancements.

11 minutes ago, Wallygator said:

We seem to be flip-flopping  in various degrees between these two modalities since .21

Hey in those days we had poor performance and  bugs

In all seriousness though, I'm not entirely sure this is fair. I'm not going to stand here and say 1.4.x is not buggy (clearly it is, and they are big bugs too), but 1.3.x had the best of both worlds (IMO). I can't think of any huge game-breaking bugs in 1.3.x and 1.2.x was also pretty stable too (I seem to remember they had a massive push in 1.2 to get it really polished).

What's the difference then between 1.2/3 and 1.4? Well, in 1.4 we didn't have a pre-release period. The cynic in me says this is because they didn't want us to know just how buggy it was and for that to hit sales of MH.

Edited April 8, 2018 by severedsolo

Well stated.

2 hours ago, severedsolo said:

Well, in 1.4 we didn't have a pre-release period.

They shouldn't need pre-release period to notice engines with off-center thrust, legs exploding, textures not matching, 5 m fairing base being bigger than 5 m..... 

I don't know if QA team  didn't ever place a 5m fairing or if they tried it but ignored the problem, but the truth is: they should have detected that. Some bugs are so obvious that make me doubt if there was even minimum QA testing for 1.4.

I got the DLC for free, but this (IMO) poorly tested update and DLC release only hurts DLC and KSP sales.

My guess is that a lot of intellectual knowledge and know how of the ksp code walked out the door with the dev exodus. The passion, dedication and ability of the new devs doesn’t makeup for the lack of ground up development in-depth knowledge of the ksp code.
